item.title: My Babashka Cookbook
item.description: This post is the one I want to reference when I do something in `babashka` and forget syntax or something. Capture a process's `STDOUT` and process the string after (require '[babashka.process :as bp]) (-> (bp/shell {:out :string} "do-the-thing") :out (clojure.string/split #"\n")) Import a local library Dynamically You can add deps as one of the first steps in your scripts. (require '[babashka.deps :as deps]) (deps/add-deps '{:deps {io.github.lispyclouds/bblgum {:git/sha "1d4de3d49b84f64d1b71930fa1161f8d2622a4d9"} dev.andylu/clj-lipgloss {:local/root "/home/andy/git/clj-lipgloss"}}}) (require '[bblgum.

item.title: Babashka Datetime
item.description: If I need a datetime in Python, I reach for from datetime import datetime datetime.now() So I need something as quick for clojure. Apparently, it’s just (-> (java.time.LocalDate/now) str) ;; => "2023-10-15"

item.title: Terminal Logging With Color
item.description: These days I’ve been writing a lot of babashka instead of reaching for bash or python to do minor scripting tasks at work. I am also a big fan of the work done at charm and the relevant products in this case are gum and lipgloss. Using gum style I can log any text in basically any color I want. And while there’s not a ton of functional benefits to this, I think there’s something to be said about adding color into the logs we write.
